exercise.translation[0].definitions[0].d: physical activities that you do in order to stay healthy and become stronger
exercise.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
Most people need to do more exercise.
Gentle exercise can be beneficial for older people.
After the operation, you should avoid strenuous exercise.
exercise.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a movement or set of movements that you do regularly to keep your body healthy
exercise.translation[0].definitions[1].e: You can do exercises to strengthen your stomach muscles.
exercise.translation[0].definitions[2].d: an activity or process that helps you practise a particular skill
exercise.translation[0].definitions[3].d: a set of questions in a book that test a student’s knowledge or skill
exercise.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Do Exercises 3 and 4 on page 51 for homework.
exercise.translation[0].definitions[4].d: an activity or situation that has a particular quality or result
exercise.translation[0].definitions[4].e: closing libraries as part of a cost-cutting exercise
Buying a house can be an exercise in frustration.
exercise.translation[0].definitions[5].d: a set of activities for training soldiers etc
exercise.translation[0].definitions[5].e: Half the unit was away on exercise.
exercise.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: physical activities that you do in order to stay healthy and become stronger
exercise.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: He ought to do more exercise.
He was advised by the doctor to take more exercise.
Swimming is very good exercise for your muscles.
Taking regular exercise is the best way to improve your overall health.
Physical exercise keeps you fit and helps to reduce stress.
Pregnant women should avoid strenuous exercise.
Try to do some gentle exercise as part of your daily routine.
Aerobic exercise, such as jogging or cycling, is a great way to burn off fat.
This type of exercise is excellent for losing weight.
Children are becoming overweight through lack of exercise.
The athletes follow an intensive exercise programme.
I’m finding it quite hard to stick to my exercise routine.
I usually go to my exercise class on Wednesdays.
exercise.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: a movement or set of movements that you do regularly to keep your body healthy
exercise.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: Try to do these exercises at least three days a week.
He showed me some basic exercises for strengthening leg muscles.
I couldn’t get to the gym, so I did a few keep-fit exercises in my bedroom.
Do some warm-up exercises before lifting heavy weights.
We do breathing exercises in my yoga class.
exercise.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to use a power, right, or quality that you have
exercise.translation[1].definitions[0].e: There are plans to encourage people to exercise their right to vote.
People who can exercise some control over their surroundings feel less anxious.
exercise.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to do sports or physical activities in order to stay healthy and become stronger
exercise.translation[1].definitions[2].d: to make a particular part of your body move in order to make it stronger
exercise.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Swimming exercises all the major muscle groups.
exercise.translation[1].definitions[3].d: to make an animal walk or run in order to keep it healthy and strong
exercise.translation[1].definitions[3].e: people exercising their dogs in the park
exercise.translation[1].definitions[4].d: to make someone think about a subject or problem and consider how to deal with it
exercise.translation[1].definitions[4].e: It’s an issue that’s exercised the minds of scientists for a long time.
exercise.translation[1].definitions[5].d: if something exercises someone, they think about it all the time and are very anxious or worried – often used humorously
exercise.translation[1].definitions[5].e: It was clear that Flavia had been exercised by this thought.
exercise.translation[1].note_box[0].sect: exercise
to walk, do sports etc in order to stay healthy and become stronger
To lose weight, exercise regularly and eat less.
do some exercise/a lot of exercise etc
this phrase is much more common than the verb exercise, and means the same thing
Her doctor said that she needed to do more exercise.
My son does very little exercise – I don’t know how he stays so slim.
Dogs need lots of exercise.
stay/keep/get in shape
to stay or to become physically healthy and strong – used especially when you consider exercise as a way to keep a nice-looking body
Try jogging with a friend who also wants to get in shape.
keep fit
to exercise regularly in order to stay healthy and strong
The class encourages older people to keep fit.
work out
to do exercise in order to be healthy and strong, especially to exercise regularly in a gym or exercise class
He works out three times a week.
tone up
to exercise in order to make your body or part of your body firmer
I need to tone up my stomach and legs.
warm up
to do gentle exercises to prepare your body for more active exercise
It’s important to warm up before you begin to play.
stretch
to reach your arms, legs, or body out to full length, in order to make your muscles as long as possible, so that you do not injure them when you exercise
Jog for five minutes, then stretch before starting on your run.
limber up
to do gentle exercises so that your muscles are warm and not tight before you begin a more active exercise
The footballers were limbering up before a training session.
to prepare for a sporting event by exercising in a particular way
She’s training to do the London Marathon.
practise
to do a sports activity regularly, in order to get better and prepare for competition
The team practices on Wednesdays and Saturdays.
exercise.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to use your power, influence or a right that you have
exercise.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Shareholders were encouraged to exercise their right to vote.
exercise.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to buy the property mentioned in an OPTION
exercise.translation[2].definitions[1].e: The seller is likely to exercise the option if the market value of the property is above the repurchase price.
